name: harcha
ingredients: A few tbsp of medium semolina (for shaping)
Crushed fennel seeds, cumin, coriander, dried herbs (optional)
steps: In a large bowl, mix the fine semolina and baking powder with the melted butter to 'sand' the semolina (like a crumble dough).
Add the salt, sugar, oil, and seeds/dried herbs (if used).
Pour in the milk to obtain a soft dough, smoother than bread dough.
Preheat a cast iron or non-stick pan over medium heat without any fat.
Sprinkle a bit of medium semolina on the hot pan.
Place the dough on the pan using wet hands and spread it quickly (max 1 cm thick). Sprinkle the top with medium semolina.
Cook for 8 to 10 minutes on each side, until it is nicely golden.
Serve plain, with butter and honey.
